subject: Re: Website Timeline
preview: Hi Heath,  I am not going to be in tomorrow. How we tracking with the images for this?  My last day is now Friday so I would like to get this finalised, maybe if can go in an edit some sections this m

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

I am not going to be in tomorrow. How we tracking with the images for this?

My last day is now Friday so I would like to get this finalised, maybe if can go in an edit some sections this might speed things up? We have for example things that we wouldn't really show to the public, like when we got Odoo. And also have KPG for Kevin's initials which no one external would know.

Also, do you think we should disable the chat function? I don't think it gets much use and I was the only one that had access to it.

Kind Regards,

Jessica Torres

MARKETING COORDINATOR

I think something like the Oodo and Syrinx, is probably not relevant for people coming to our website, they're not going to really care. Some photos to include below. The first one is what the site looked like before RAM took over. The photo with Kevin in the snow is him on a factory visit in Finland. Image of the product guide attached.

From: Jessica Torres | RAM Equipment
Sent: Thursday, 17 September 2020 11:38 AM
To: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Subject: Website Timeline
Hi Heath,
As discussed RAM want's to incorporate a timeline on the website to go under about us. I don't seem to see too many of them, these days, is it an outdated practice?
Anyway, I think it is a good opportunity to build on our awareness and deliver content in a different way. I had a scrounge around the web and couldn't find too many examples I liked. I do remember Canva used to have one that I really liked but again, I am wondering if it's an outdated thing.
Some that I have liked are:
https://www.annefrank.org/en/anne-frank/the-timeline/#key-moment-42-list
https://www.evanshalshaw.com/more/bondcars/c19.html
https://moz.com/about
I think my vision is to have a vertical timeline shown, where as the user scrolls down the page, things start to move in and appear, a bit like how on the homepage the buy and hire descriptions zoom in from the edge of the screen. Also, I like how the numbers move in the RAM difference section, so there's a bit of interactivity happening on the page, rather than being something static. Are we able to do something similar? Of course, I welcome your ideas too and what you think would work best.
Not sure if it will be easier for you to build the template and then I can go in with the content, or I give you the content and you build it from there. Let me know.
Below screen shot of the type of content we'd look to in include - somethings are not relevant for external people.
<image007.png>
Kind Regards,
Jessica Torres
